techmeme.title: Instagram rolls out new settings to fight sextortion, like hiding teens' follower lists from potential blackmailers; Meta says the crime is becoming more common (Washington Post)
Enterprise data security startup Cyera buys data loss startup Trail Security for $162M in cash and stock; sources: Cyera is raising $200M+ at a ~$3B valuation (Ingrid Lunden/TechCrunch)
Sources: the EU warns X that it may calculate fines against X by including Elon Musk's other companies' revenue; the DSA can fine 6% of global annual revenue (Bloomberg)
UK study: employers running grad schemes received an average of 140 applications for each job in 2024, a record and up 59% YoY, as AI makes applying easier (Financial Times)
South Korea plans stronger measures to prevent leaks of advanced tech and business secrets; the NIS says there were 40 attempted chip secret leaks in five years (Reuters)
